body_html:
But what's the right version mean? and can we make them be syncronized automatically?
I found this issue keep happening after my ubuntu upgrade its components, everytime I need debug this issue mannually. Now my current error logs are:

@> 2018-01-22 10:12:52.860623: E tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_driver.cc:406] failed call to cuInit: CUDA_ERROR_NO_DEVICE

2018-01-22 10:12:52.860688: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_diagnostics.cc:158] retrieving CUDA diagnostic information for host: clockAsusDesktop
2018-01-22 10:12:52.860714: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_diagnostics.cc:165] hostname: clockAsusDesktop
2018-01-22 10:12:52.860790: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_diagnostics.cc:189] libcuda reported version is: 384.111.0
2018-01-22 10:12:52.860851: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_diagnostics.cc:369] driver version file contents: """NVRM version: NVIDIA UNIX x86_64 Kernel Module 384.90 Tue Sep 19 19:17:35 PDT 2017
GCC version: gcc version 5.4.0 20160609 (Ubuntu 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.5)
"""
2018-01-22 10:12:52.860907: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_diagnostics.cc:193] kernel reported version is: 384.90.0
2018-01-22 10:12:52.860934: E tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_diagnostics.cc:303] kernel version 384.90.0 does not match DSO version 384.111.0 -- cannot find working devices in this

But what's the right version mean? and can we make them be syncronized automatically?
I found this issue keep happening after my ubuntu upgrade its components, everytime I need debug this issue mannually. Now my current error logs are:

body:
But what's the right version mean? and can we make them be syncronized automatically? 
I found this issue keep happening after my ubuntu upgrade its components, everytime I need debug this issue mannually. Now my current error logs are:

@> 2018-01-22 10:12:52.860623: E tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_driver.cc:406] failed call to cuInit: CUDA_ERROR_NO_DEVICE
> 2018-01-22 10:12:52.860688: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_diagnostics.cc:158] retrieving CUDA diagnostic information for host: clockAsusDesktop
> 2018-01-22 10:12:52.860714: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_diagnostics.cc:165] hostname: clockAsusDesktop
> 2018-01-22 10:12:52.860790: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_diagnostics.cc:189] libcuda reported version is: 384.111.0
> 2018-01-22 10:12:52.860851: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_diagnostics.cc:369] driver version file contents: """NVRM version: NVIDIA UNIX x86_64 Kernel Module  384.90  Tue Sep 19 19:17:35 PDT 2017
> GCC version:  gcc version 5.4.0 20160609 (Ubuntu 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.5) 
> """
> 2018-01-22 10:12:52.860907: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_diagnostics.cc:193] kernel reported version is: 384.90.0
> 2018-01-22 10:12:52.860934: E tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_diagnostics.cc:303] kernel version 384.90.0 does not match DSO version 384.111.0 -- cannot find working devices in this
